tool.name: BAM Coverage Plotter
tool.description: Plot read coverage across a genomic contig
tool.command: #set include_regex = str($adv.include_contig_regex).strip() #set exclude_regex = str($adv.skip_contig_regex).strip() #set alignment_name = str($alignment_file.element_identifier) #if str($reference.source) == "history" ln -s '$reference.hist_genome' reference.fasta && samtools faidx reference.fasta && #else #set ref_path = str($reference.cached_genome.fields.path) #set ref_index_path = str($reference.cached_genome.fields.path) + '.fai' ln -s '$ref_path' reference.fasta && ln -s '$ref_index_path' reference.fasta.fai && #end if samtools view -H '$alignment_file' |grep -E '^(@HD|@SQ)' >reference.dict && cat reference.dict && ln -s '$alignment_file' '$alignment_name' && ln -s '${alignment_file.metadata.bam_index}' '${alignment_name}.bai' && wgscoverageplotter.py --reference reference.fasta --dimension '$dimension' --output plot.svg $adv.disable_paired_overlap #if $include_regex -I '$include_regex' #end if #if $exclude_regex -X '$exclude_regex' #end if --mapq $adv.min_mapq --max-depth $adv.max_depth $adv.clip --min-contig-length '$adv.min_contig_length' --percentile $adv.percentile $adv.points #if str($adv.sample_filter.filter_by_sample) == "true" --samples '$adv.sample_filter.samples' --partition '$adv.sample_filter.partition' #end if '$alignment_name' && #if str($format) == "SVG" mv plot.svg '$plot_output' #else convert plot.svg '$format:$plot_output' #end if

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in genome?
param.option: Use a genome from my history

param.name: cached_genome
param.label: Reference genome
param.help: The FASTA reference genome that reads were mapped against.

param.name: hist_genome
param.label: Reference genome
param.help: The FASTA reference genome that reads were mapped against.

param.name: format
param.label: Output format
param.help: Note that SVG might not display correctly on all Galaxy servers

param.name: disable_paired_overlap
param.label: Count overlapping bases with mate for paired-end

param.name: include_contig_regex
param.label: Only keep chromosomes matching this regular expression.

param.name: max_depth
param.label: y-axis (depth) limit of the plot
param.help: The special value '-1' will first compute the average depth and the set the max depth to 2*average

param.label: Clip the plot at the y-axis limit
param.help: Default is to let the coverage plot exceed the y-axis limit

param.name: min_contig_length
param.label: Skip chromosomes shorter than
param.help: A distance specified as a positive integer.

validator.message: A positive integer optionally followed by the suffixes b,bp,k,kb,m,mb is required

param.label: How to bin the coverage under one pixel
Plot coverage using points instead of areas

param.name: skip_contig_regex
param.label: Skip chromosomes matching this regular expression
Limit to these read groups
param.help: See also --partition. Multiple read groups can be separated with commas.

validator.message: If a filter is being used, this field cannot be blank

param.label: How to interpret identifiers in --samples
param.help: Partitions are modelled on the GATK logic as described here: https://gatk.broadinstitute.org/hc/en-us/articles/360051307491-DepthOfCoverage-BETA-#--partition-type

tool.help:
**WGSCoveragePlotter from the jvarkit toolkit**
WGSCoveragePlotter_ is a tool to plot the coverage of aligned reads across a genomic contig. It takes as input a BAM file and a genomic contig in FASTA format and produces an image in either PNG or SVG format showing the depth of read coverage across the contig.
.. _WGSCoveragePlotter: http://lindenb.github.io/jvarkit/WGSCoveragePlotter.html
